website_summaries.verdict: Cutouts add style to this heavy-duty fire ring, while the mesh keeps hot coals inside the ring.
pros: 1/2" lip around top and bottom adds stability
Includes log poker and assembly hardware
Steel mesh design allows for durability and good airflow for fire
cons: If you use water to put out your fire, it can warp the metal

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts 2-3 years
customer_reviews.text: This is not a permanent fire pit solution. This one started rusting the second year and this year, the third year, it is falling apart and spilling out contents. I don’t know if a galvanized metal would last longer. We are right now considering whether or not to replace this ring with another similar metal ring or do a stacked stone fire pit. We only paid $25 for this one in 2016 but they have increased in price so, don’t know if we want to keep paying again and again for this.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Butler

customer_reviews.title: Overall Very Nice Fire Ring
customer_reviews.text: Attractive Fire ring; nice quality materials. Mine came missing one of the Nut, bolt, and washers set for assembly. I contacted customer support and they quickly shipped out replacement parts. So far my only complaint is that the included log poker is only 16" long total with only 11.5" past the handle which is really short if you are dealing with a hot fire
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Attractive Ring That Goes Together Easily
customer_reviews.text: This was a housewarming gift for our daughter. It is very nice looking and she and her husband both really like (love?) it! It is not very heavy gauge metal, so durability may be an issue down the road and the tiny fire poker isn't useful for much beyond an equally tiny fire (and who does that?) It went together easily and was easy to load into our car and transport. All-in-all a good product that should last 2 -3 years and look better than a bare spot with charred wood in it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Peters

customer_reviews.title: EZ to put together
customer_reviews.text: This fire ring was very easy to put together. It came with a little tool , also. I had to have help, as I am older, the screws are very easy, but they are in a tiny location, and I had a bit of trouble, at 66. A person 15-55 should be able to to easily assemble this with no help. It was very lightweight, I carried each panel to the location, and then only put in the top screw on each panel, which , for now, seems to be ok.

customer_reviews.title: Good fire ring, definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: For the price point of this fire ring, I am very happy with it. However, don't expect a heavy duty, ring here. For the occasional home fire I'm sure it will last many years. But. If you are buying this for a home or rental property where it will be used multiple times a week, year round, then I'd look at some a bit more expensive that will have higher gauge steel. Installation was a breeze, provided you have a couple wrenches, took me less than 10 minutes to get it assembled. I would buy it again.
